intro: Chrysosplenium taibaishanense, commonly known as the Taibaishan chrysosplenium, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Its foliage is typically dense and succulent, adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
